DataElement.preferredName: Dentist Pain Therapy Medication Recommendation Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a subdivision related to the dentist's advice of medication for pain relief.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the dentist's advice of medication for pain relief.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An individual licensed for the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases in the oral cavity, adjacent tissues, and related structures.

Concepts.definition: An individual licensed for the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases in the oral cavity, adjacent tissues, and related structures.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pain relief.:biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.:Recommendation; advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

Concepts.definition: (i) the systematic study of clinical and basic science and its application for the reduction of pain and suffering; (ii) the blending of tools, techniques and principles taken from the discrete healing art disciplines and reformulated as a holistic application for the reduction of pain and suffering; and (iii) a newly emerging discipline emphasizing an interdisciplinary approach with a goal of reduction of pain and suffering. (AAPM)

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a subdivision of medication recommended by dentist.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A class of synthetic chemicals/drugs similar to opiates (opium derivatives) with analgesic properties.  Due to binding to opiate receptors, opioids mimic opiate activity on neurons, various cells (i.e. lymphocytes), pain suppression and other neurobehavioral activity. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A class of synthetic chemicals/drugs similar to opiates (opium derivatives) with analgesic properties.  Due to binding to opiate receptors, opioids mimic opiate activity on neurons, various cells (i.e. lymphocytes), pain suppression and other neurobehavioral activity. (NCI)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any agent that relaxes skeletal muscles and reduces muscle contraction.

Concepts.definition: Any agent that relaxes skeletal muscles and reduces muscle contraction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (an-tee-kon-VUL-sants) Drugs that prevent, reduce, or stop convulsions or seizures.

Concepts.definition: Medicine to stop, prevent, or control seizures (convulsions).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ReferenceDocuments.description: What type of drugs would you commonly prescribe for acute orofacial or dental pain
